comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: RAMC profile of: Archibald Craig AMY M.D. Place or Date of Birth: Service Number: TF Number: Rank: Maj Unit: 10 Stationary Hospital Attached To: Enlistment Location: Also Served: 2/1st Highland Field Ambulance Outcome: Date Died: Age Died: Where Buried and/or Commemorated: Awards: MiD; DSO Gazette Reference: 10/07/1919 Other Information: Capt Amy joined No 10 Stationery Hospital on the 5th August 1914. He was Mentioned in Despatches in October 1914. Capt Amy was promoted to Major. www.ramc-ww1.com/profile.php?cPath=625_277_311&profil... Captain A C Amy and Mrs Amy were present as part of British General Hospital. CAMP 45. R.A.M.C. December 1911 for the Coronation Durbar in Delhi. In a Supplement to the BMJ under Naval and Military Appointments dated March 30, 1912, p 363, Captain A C Amy MB is transferred from Meerut to Ranikhet (India)

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
Archibald C Amy born in Paisley Renfrewshire Scotland in 1882/3 as per 1891 and 1901 Censuses. 
Archibald Craig Amy married in Farnham, Registered the 1st qr 1907 Source: FreeBMD

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
There are several Gazette references, starting in 1919 (as a major) and ending in 1942 (as a colonel) with:
SUPPLEMENT TO THE LONDON GAZETTE, 19 MAY, 1942 REGULAR ARMY RESERVE OF OFFICERS. GENERAL LIST. The undermentioned Cols. , having attained the age limit of liability to recall, cease to belong to the Res. of Off. : — 
A .C .Amy, D.S.O., M.D. (11033), (late R.A.M.C.). I4th May 1942.

Major A C Amy DSO, RAMC Deputy Director of Hygiene, East Anglian Area, wrote an article in the Royal United Services Institution. Journal
Volume 73, Issue 489, 1928 pp 67-71 entitled "Physical Training".

He had become a  Lt.-Col., 10th July 1930.  In  a report of the Drugs Enquiry Committee 1930-31 he is described as Commanding the British Military Hospital in Rawalpindi.
He had vacated his appointment in India (held since 10th Oct. 1932) and had retired on retirement pay D.D.H.&P.—Col.A.C.Amy, D.S.O.,Brit Serv.,10th Oct.1936.
